publicationStmt.publisher: Centre for Computing in the Humanities, King's College London

address.addrLine: Strand, London WC2R 2LS, England, United Kingdom. Tel:+44 (0) 20 7836 5454

availability.p: This resource is publicly available and free at the point of access and it is registered under a a Creative Commons license Attribution-Share Alike 3.0

sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

encodingDesc.p: Encoding according to the CCH TEI Guidelines at http://www.cch.kcl.ac.uk/xmod/about/encoding/

div.p: Schenker Documents Online contains a variety of materials other than diaries, correspondence, and lessonbooks. These are present not so much in their own right as as supporting documents for items in those three main categories.
These materials include the texts of articles and reviews, newspaper notices, obituaries, and separately printed brochures such as prospectuses of institutions.
Because these materials are not primary to SDO (although none the less important), they are not always accompanied by an English translation, footnotes, or other editorial commentary.
